dublin_core.dcvalue: The debate around the role of the work at personal computer as cause of De Quervain s Tenosynovitis was developed partially without considering multidisciplinary available data A systematic review of the literature using an evidence based approach was performed In disorders associated with the use of VDU we must distinguish those at the upper limbs and among them those related to an overload Experimental studies on the occurrence of De Quervain s Tenosynovitis are quite limited as well as clinically are quite difficult to prove the professional etiology considering the interference due to other activities of daily living or to the biological susceptibility i e anatomical variability sex age exercise At present there is no evidence of any connection between De Quervain syndrome and time of use of the personal computer or keyboard limited evidence of correlation is found with time using a mouse No data are available regarding the use exclusively or predominantly for personal laptops or mobile smart phone
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-06T17:15:06Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2013-02-14
Giornale italiano di medicina del lavoro ed ergonomia
[Computer work and De Quervain's tenosynovitis: an evidence based approach].
